snippet: When it’s time for founders to pass the torch, a fallout can occur, leaving adult children feeling slighted. But proactive steps can help ease the transition.
abstract: Paul Sullivan Wealth Matters column notes advice from consultants on how to have a conversation about the legacy of running a family business; observes too often a parent, and founder of family business, expects to retire and turn business over to an adult child who may prefer another profession entirely.
lead_paragraph: When it’s time for founders to pass the torch, a fallout can occur, leaving adult children feeling slighted. But proactive steps can help ease the transition.

headline.print_headline: Tough Choices for Succession in the Family Business
